Section.name: About BVCEC
Section.description:
BVC College of Engineering is one of the top engineering colleges located in Andhra Pradesh. With its state of the art infrastructure, dedicated faculty and its excellent placement record, the college provides the students with a good learning environment. It is affiliated with JNTUK Kakinada. The college offers B.Tech, and Polytechnic Diploma across several specializations. Admission to the college is done based on the entrance exam.
Read More: BVC College of Engineering Courses & Fees
BVC College of Engineering AP EAPCET Cutoff 2024 is out. The table given below shows the cutoff for Round 1.
Admission to B.Tech course is based on EAMCET or JEE Main while admission to Diploma is based on POLYCET
The College has a library, hostels, sports Complex, common computer centre, canteen for students and better campus life.
Most of the staff members are highly experienced and qualified. Many of them are Ph.D holders that have published many research papers in international and nationally publications. Each department of the college has its own head. The rest of faculties hold the following positions:
Read More: BVC College of Engineering Faculty
Ques. Is BVC College of Engineering a good college for B.Tech?
Ans. Yes. BVC College of Engineering offers a variety of specializations under B.Tech. It has state of the art facilities, a dedicated faculty, a vibrant campus life and an excellent placement record.
Ques. Does BVC College of Engineering provide good placements?
Ans. BVC College of Engineering has a good placement record. They have signed MOU with many companies who provide industrial training to the students. The college organises on-campus recruitment opportunities in which it invited several companies.The college organises on-campus recruitment opportunities in which it has invited several companies. Wipro, Singularity, Syntel, HCL, Ashok Leyland are the top recruiters.
Ques. How is the infrastructure of BVC College of Engineering?
Ans. BVC College of Engineering has good infrastructure. It has spacious and well ventilated classrooms, a computer lab equipped with multiple computers, an air-conditioned seminar hall, an affordable canteen and several science labs.
Ques. What is the B.Tech intake at BVC College of Engineering?
Ans. The B.Tech intake is given below:
Ques. How are the faculties at BVC College of Engineering?
Ans. The faculty members are well qualified and experienced in their respective fields. Many professors hold a Ph.D degree and have published many research papers in international and nationally publications.
